channel.title: Moparscape Illeagul?
channel.description:
Well I have been playing on hundreds of moparscape servers and now i decide i want to make my own!
and i asked me dad (because he knows bout computer stuff alot) and he said no so of course i said why?
And he said: Moparscape is illeagul to make a server of copying jagex graphix. And 1 day all the ppl who made servers r goin to b in like in almost prison
Is that true?

item.title: Moparscape Illeagul?
item.dc:creator: @i_ownd_u_i i ownd u i
item.description:
@i_ownd_u_i wrote:

rog3r is right.

317 was made not by jagex even though it looks like the same it is totaly not all the codeing
is differnet, 474 - 503 - 508 is basic jagex, what i know is runescape codes r used into client
and do not worry about the server so basicly if your makeing money off there codeing of the
client you would be sued.

All the sprites and models were created by jagex so this is why they are getting worred in case
someone copys runescape as it is now.

This is why they are bring plays back with pking.

Its is not worth getting worried about makeing a server because getting court is like 1 in a 1.000.000,
there is 1 way of getting court and it is though internet clients which is a webclient make sure you
have some king of internet protection on it such as perguardion.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Illeagul?
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

Rog3r:

Yes but if you use it on lets say Silabsofts client, then you can’t be held account.

Silabsoft’s client is still a modified Jagex client, it’s temporarily stored on your computer and the cache is stored. But still, Jagex aren’t going to go after players for using a client, they probably could care less, it’s just the ones who are making and charging to play that seem to go down.

You must [b]not use[/b] a [b]modified[/b]/customised version of the [b]client[/b] software
On another topic

if someone customized the game enough and made custom sprites and stuff

If someone did that it’d have to a total client from scratch (not using anything of Jagex’s, mind you) and a server from scratch, using NOTHING from Jagex, including the stream and cryption (which shouldn’t be used if a client is from scratch). All ideas would have to be totally ours and not Jagex’s. It would be a different game, not a RSPS.

Read full topic

item.title: Moparscape Illeagul?
item.dc:creator: @hidendra Hidendra
item.description:
@hidendra wrote:

Rog3r:

Or you just use a TOS for your webclient and you wouldn’t have to worry about getting caught.

Those aren’t legally binding.

Has anyone read RuneScape’s ToS? I’m guessing not, I’ll help:
Link: http://www.runescape.com/terms/terms.ws

RuneScape ToS:

You must not reverse-engineer, decompile or modify any Jagex Product client software in any way (except to the extent allowed by applicable law). You must not use a modified/customised version of the client software or attempt to sub-license it. You must not create or provide any other means by which any Jagex Product may be played by others (including, without limitation, replacement or modified client/server software, server emulators).

We reverse-engineered their client. We decompiled and deobfuscated it. We modify their client. As well, others play them. It looks like it’s sort of legal if we play on them by ourselves.

(including, without limitation, replacement or modified [b]client/server software, server emulators[/b]).
This makes it illegal. We use Jagex's stream class and cryption, further stealing work. Our servers are emulators for Jagex's clients that we edit and redistribute

Read full topic
